title: What is the greatest song without lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: I usually don’t answer questions that hundreds of people answered before, but I couldn’t help this one. I scanned through as many as I could and yet did not find any of these songs on the list. I did see lots of Rush (we’re going to miss you, Neil Peart), classical music (I could have sworn the question asked for songs, not symphonies) and movie music (just ask yourself, would you like that music if you didn’t like Lord of the Rings or Star Wars?) So without I chose songs that were written by musicians who mostly wrote songs. I’m not sure they’re the greatest, but I really like them.  Europa (Earth's Cry Heaven's Smile) - Santana I’m rather shocked this didn’t make it. This song is from Carlos Santana’s first album after Greg Rolie left to form the band Journey called Amigos. The album is also known because he reduced the Latin influence and went for a more jazz sound.  Masoko Tanga - The Police This is the last song from their first album. I know what you’re thinking, Sting is singing. While some sites actually list lyrics, my untrained ears don’t hear any words that make sense. This is a jam, just something to fill time and sounded good enough to put on the album.  Chitlins Con Carne - Stevie Ray Vaughan This is an instrumental from Vaughan’s last album before his untimely death. He wanted to push in a jazz direction so he channeled a song written by guitarist Kenny Burell. The title translates into “Pork with Pork?” Whatever. By the way, music fans, songs without words are also known as instrumentals.
